Newly admitted lawyers are expected to complete professional legal education before entering practice, and as a result are likely to be less experienced than those who have completed more years of legal education, but that doesn't necessarily mean they are less competent than their long-practicing counterparts. 

Newly admitted lawyers typically have more knowledge and understanding of the law, however, they may not have the same level of experience as those who have been practicing for an extended period of time, as they are required to complete their professional education before practicing.
